resources.title: Augury, the New Angular 2 Debugging Tool & the Gov'ts Move to AngularJS
resources.description: In this talk from the AngularJS Toronto Meetup, Yuri Takhyetev and Igor Krivanov announce a new Chrome plug-in, Augury, a tool to help inspect Angular 2 applications and Colin Chan presents a case-study of Ontario.ca’s move to AngularJS and the MEAN Stack.
resources.author: Talk by Colin Chan, Yuri Takhyetev, Igor Kamenetsky

resources.title: Mastering Your Angular 2 Workflow with Augury (formerly Batarangle), TypeScript, Webpack and More
resources.description: Rangle's Angular 2.0 team presents a webinar providing a complete overview of how you can master your Angular 2.0 Workflow using key tools.
resources.author: Webinar by Michael Bennett, Igor Kamenetsky, Rangle's Angular 2.0 team

resources.title: Look Deeply Into Your App with Augury
resources.description: In this talk, Igor and Vanessa introduce Angular Augury - a Chrome Developer Tools extension created by the Rangle team that allows developers to visualize their Angular 2 application’s component tree and the data associated with it.
resources.author: Talk by Igor Kamenetsky and Vanessa Yuen, developers at Rangle

resources.title: Angular Codegen and Precompile, plus Augury
resources.description: This year's AngularJS Toronto meetup featured Google's Angular core team member, Matias Niemelä. Vanessa Yuen and Sumit Arora from Rangle's own Angular team presented Augury.
resources.author: Talk by Vanessa Yuen, Sumit Arora, developers at Rangle

resources.title: The Evolution of Augury, for Angular 2 Applications
resources.description: Augury, Rangle’s Chrome Developer Tool extension, allows developers to look deeply into their Angular 2 application by visualizing their component tree and the data associated with it.
resources.author: Blog by Amrita Chopra

resources.title: Debugging Angular 2 Apps with Augury
resources.description: Angular 2 helpful debugging with Augury. Augury is a Google Chrome extension for debugging Angular 2 applications, just like Batarang is for debugging Angular 1.* Apps, and is accessible via the Chrome Dev Tools.
resources.author: Blog by Ganga Chris
